interests.name: Swayambhunath
interests.description: Swayambhunath is an ancient religious architecture atop a hill in the Kathmandu Valley, west of Kathmandu city. The Tibetan name for the site means 'Sublime Trees', for the many varieties of trees found on the hill.
interests.review: Beautiful scenery, lots of tourists but it still is away from the chaos of Kathmandu.

interests.name: Ahsan Manzil
interests.description: Ahsan Manzil was the official residential palace and seat of the Nawab of Dhaka. The building is situated at Kumartoli along the banks of the Buriganga River in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
interests.review: Friends took us to this place. Authentic and feel sacred. Located in old town Dhaka. People are friendly.

interests.name: Gateway Of India Mumbai
interests.description: The Gateway of India is an arch monument built during the 20th century in Mumbai, India. The monument was erected to commemorate the landing of King-EmperorGeorge V and Queen-Empress Mary at Apollo Bunder on their visit to India in 1911.

interests.name: Pashupatinath Temple
interests.description: The Pashupatinath Temple is a famous and sacred Hindu temple complex that is located on the banks of the Bagmati River, approximately 5 kilometres north-east of Kathmandu in the eastern part of Kathmandu Valley, the capital of Nepal.

interests.name: Boudhanath
interests.description: Boudhanath is a stupa in Kathmandu, Nepal. Located about 11 km from the center and northeastern outskirts of Kathmandu, the stupa's massive mandala makes it one of the largest spherical stupas in Nepal.

interests.name: Lalbagh Fort
interests.description: Lalbagh Fort is an incomplete 17th century Mughal fort complex that stands before the Buriganga River in the southwestern part of Dhaka, Bangladesh.

interests.name: Jatiya Sangsad Bhaban
interests.description: Jatiya Sangsad Bhaban or National Parliament House, is the house of the Parliament of Bangladesh, located at Sher-e-Bangla Nagar in the Bangladeshi capital of Dhaka.

interests.name: Elephanta Caves
interests.description: Elephanta Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a collection of cave temples predominantly dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.

interests.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus railway station
interests.description: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, formerly known as Victoria Terminus, is a historic railway station and a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India which serves as the headquarters of the Central Railways.
